meanings.definition: To insert between layers of something else.
meanings.sent1: She likes to interlard her lasagna with extra cheese.
meanings.sent2: The chef will interlard the cake layers with raspberry filling.
meanings.sent3: The students decided to interlard their presentation with funny jokes.
meanings.sent4: His speech was interlarded with quotes from famous authors.
meanings.sent5: The artist would interlard the canvas with vibrant colors to create a striking effect.

meanings.definition: To mix or intersperse with something else.
meanings.sent1: The author would interlard his writing with historical references.
meanings.sent2: The gardener will interlard the flowers with different shades of pink.
meanings.sent3: The comedian would interlard his jokes with funny sound effects.
meanings.sent4: Her speech was interlarded with heartfelt anecdotes.
meanings.sent5: The chef would interlard the dish with aromatic herbs for added flavor.
